meanings.definition: To surpass in gaining more than.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit outgained the turtle in the race.
meanings.sent2: She outgained her classmates in the math competition.
meanings.sent3: The little ant outgained the big grasshopper in collecting food.
meanings.sent4: The sun outgained the moon in brightness during the day.
meanings.sent5: The river outgained its banks during the heavy rain, flooding the fields.

meanings.definition: To exceed in gaining more than.
meanings.sent1: The company outgained its competitors in sales this quarter.
meanings.sent2: He outgained his own record in the high jump event.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outgained the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outgained the sound of the thunderstorm outside.
meanings.sent5: The flames outgained the firefighters' efforts, spreading rapidly through the forest.
